description: Users may experience instability in Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) version 125.0.2535.85 due to a heap corruption issue that has been documented. This problem manifests as unexpected crashes, particularly when interacting with crafted HTML pages, which may lead to loss of session data and web content. Additionally, users might notice performance degradation or unresponsiveness of the browser, especially when loading complex web applications that potentially trigger the vulnerability. The situation has been addressed in the update to version 125.0.6422.141, ensuring that users upgrading to this build will no longer be affected by the underlying issue linked to CVE-2024-5494. Details regarding this vulnerability can be found in KB-125.0.2535.85, which is crucial for users looking to mitigate risks associated with this specific build.
